Issue: Real estate scraper copied photos/listings; enforceability of browse-wrap terms
Holding: Liable for copyright infringement and breach of contract; browse-wrap terms enforceable
Remedy/Damages: Permanent injunction; CAD $32,000 statutory damages plus nominal damages
Business Impact: Decision shut down data scraping; confirms website terms can restrict copying

Issue: CarGurus scraped vehicle photos from dealer sites; fair dealing defense; framing constitutes infringement
Holding: Found liable for copyright infringement; fair dealing rejected; framing = making available
Business Impact: Platforms must assess license chains; framing photos = copyright infringement

Issue: Website republished Canadian tribunal decisions to drive SEO/advertising; PIPEDA compliance
Holding: Breached PIPEDA; ordered removal of Canadian decisions and de-indexing
Remedy/Damages: CAD $5,000 damages plus costs; compliance order (de-indexing/erasure)
Business Impact: Republishing court decisions for profit without consent violates privacy law
Legal Basis: Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)

Issue: Scraped obituaries for commercial republication without permission
Holding: Held liable for copyright infringement; fair dealing not available
Remedy/Damages: CAD $20 million statutory and aggravated damages; permanent injunction
Business Impact: Commercial scraping of text without license restricted; must respect takedown requests

Case Name: Toronto Real Estate Board v. Mongohouse
Issue: Mongohouse obtained/displayed TREB data via iHome in breach of licensing
Holding: Court granted order restraining unauthorized access to TREB data
Business Impact: Third-party website taken offline; platforms must comply with licensing orders
Legal Basis: Court order enforcing competition tribunal/licensing obligations

Issue: Equustek sought worldwide de-indexing injunction against Google
Holding: Upheld interlocutory injunction requiring global removal of search results
Business Impact: Courts can order global de-indexing when local remedies ineffective

Issue: Whether land survey plans in provincial registry subject to Crown copyright
Holding: Survey plans published under Crown direction/control are Crown works; copyright vests in province
Business Impact: Materials filed in government registries may be owned by Crown; private surveyors cannot claim copyright

Issue: Challenge to forum-selection clause in Facebook terms; privacy claim under BC Privacy Act
Holding: Forum-selection clause unenforceable due to inequality of bargaining power and public policy
Remedy/Damages: Action allowed in BC; forum clause not enforced
Business Impact: Consumer terms may be overridden when conflicting with privacy statutes/public policy
Legal Basis: Forum selection law; BC Privacy Act; unconscionability

Case Name: Dell Computer v. Union des consommateurs
Issue: Challenge to mandatory arbitration clause and hyperlink notice in electronic contract
Holding: Arbitration clause valid under Civil Code but subject to consumer protection review
Remedy/Damages: Decision clarified enforceability standards for online contracts
Business Impact: Established guidance on enforceability of online terms; emphasized adequate notice and fairness
Legal Basis: Quebec Civil Code; arbitration; consumer protection

Issue: Unconscionability of arbitration clause in Uber's standard-form contract with drivers
Holding: Arbitration clause unconscionable and invalid; class action can proceed
Business Impact: Sets high bar for arbitration clauses in platform contracts; mandates fairness and access to justice

Issue: Alleged crowdsourced postal-code database infringed Canada Post copyright
Holding: Case settled; Canada Post discontinued lawsuit
Remedy/Damages: Action discontinued; no judgment or penalty
Business Impact: Win for open data; tension between government-owned databases and crowdsourced data

Issue: CanLII alleges bulk scraping of legal decisions in breach of terms of use and copyright
Holding: Civil claim filed Nov 2024; litigation pending as of Nov 2025
Remedy/Damages: Lawsuit seeks injunction and damages; outcome not yet determined
Business Impact: AI/LLM companies scraping legal data may face breach of contract and copyright claims
Legal Basis: Breach of contract (terms of use); copyright; injunction
Source URL: BC Supreme Court registry; media coverage

Issue: Publishers allege OpenAI trained models on news content without license; TPM circumvention claims
Holding: Litigation ongoing; no decision as of Nov 2025
Remedy/Damages: Seeking injunctions and damages; no judgment yet
Business Impact: Significant AI-era dispute over training data; outcome will shape scraping/licensing practices
Legal Basis: Copyright Act; TPM circumvention; breach of contract; unjust enrichment
Source URL: Ontario Superior Court; Statement of Claim CV-24-00732231-00CL
